cause.description:
Since 1987, AIDS Walk San Francisco has raised over $65 million for HIV /AIDS programs and services in the SF Bay Area. In 2007 alone, 25,000 participants raised a record sum of $4.6 million for the San Francisco AIDS Foundation and more than 40 Bay Area HIV/AIDS organizations.
AIDS Walk San Francisco is notable not only for its size, but also for its diversity. People of all ages, races, and backgrounds come together each year in a massive, powerful, and inspiring demonstration of compassion and action.
Funds generated from AIDS Walk San Francisco benefit the San Francisco AIDS Foundation (SFAF). For 26 years, SFAF has provided direct services to thousands of people living with or at risk for HIV/AIDS.
Join AIDS Walk San Francisco in Golden Gate Park on Sunday, July 19, 2009 and help end the crisis that affects us all. Sign up to walk today! To start a team, register to walk, volunteer and fundraise go to www.aidswalk.net/sanfran or call or office at (415) 615-9255.
1. To raise critical funds for HIV/AIDS programs and services in the SF Bay Area.
2. To extend our support and compassion for those living with HIV/AIDS and their families.
3. Find out more at www.aidswalk.net/sanfran
cause.mission: An annual fundraising walkathon in San Francisco's Golden Gate Park to raise funds for the San Francisco AIDS Foundation and other HIV/AIDS organizations in the SF Bay Area.
cause.name: AIDS Walk San Francisco
